multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: equities; Italy's July job creation lifts Euro Stoxx 50 modestly, but weak growth tempers upside.

category.motivation: The article reports Italy’s July unemployment rate, a major macroeconomic data release (jobs report).

impact.motivation: The article reports a new unemployment figure for Italy, directly affecting the Italy unemployment node, indicating modest labor market improvement amid weak growth.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports recent labor market statistics for Italy, reflecting immediate changes in unemployment and employment.

article_node.title: Italy July jobless rate falls to 6.0%, with 13,000 jobs created
article_node.summary: Italy’s July unemployment rate fell to 6.0% from 6.2% in June, with a net creation of 13,000 jobs and a drop in youth unemployment to 18.7%. Employment rose 0.2% over the three‑month period, adding 218,000 workers year‑on‑year, but the economy contracted 0.1% in Q2 and is projected to grow only 0.6% this year. The data suggest modest labor market gains amid weak economic growth and stagnant wages.
